findings.interpretation: Day side is warm but not sufficient alone to prove a bare surface; this temperature exceeds simple bare-rock predictions and suggests atmospheric moderation
Non-zero redistribution is favored; indicates heat transport beyond immediate bare-rock reradiation, consistent with atmospheric circulation
Planet appears very dark in thermal-energy balance fits; suggests low reflectivity and possible lava oceans or dark surface materials

findings.metric: 15 um CO2 spectral band depth estimate
findings.interpretation: Spectral structure is consistent with atmospheric absorption; detection of CO2 band suggests presence of greenhouse gases in atmosphere
Atmosphere-bearing models provide 7.4 times better fit to combined data products than no-atmosphere scenario; moderately strong evidence favoring atmospheric interpretation

findings.metric: Preferred pressure scale in CO2-rich retrieval
findings.interpretation: Moderate-pressure atmosphere family remains plausible; suggests potentially substantial atmosphere rather than tenuous exosphere

controls_or_null_results.statement: A pure no-atmosphere model cannot simultaneously match both phase amplitude and spectral band behavior
O2-rich atmosphere cases are not fully ruled out by current data; atmospheric composition remains uncertain
Degeneracies between composition, clouds/hazes, and circulation assumptions remain significant and affect interpretation
